sentences.en: APEC seems be drowning in an ocean of jargon.
sentences.cn: 亚太经合组织似乎为一大堆空洞的胡言乱语所淹没。

sentences.en: Can someone translate this legal jargon into plain English for me?
sentences.cn: 谁能把这一法律术语用简单易懂的英语给我说一遍?

sentences.en: He spoke such a jargon I couldn't make head or tail of what he said.
sentences.cn: 他讲那么一种方言土语,我根本不懂他说什么.

sentences.en: I couldn't make out the baby's jargon.
sentences.cn: 我听不懂那婴孩说的难懂的话.

sentences.en: In his hands, comic jargon and dialect became a finished literary weapon.
sentences.cn: 在他的手里, 诙谐的方言,俚语成了完美的文字武器.

sentences.en: In the jargon, they are all embraced by the term " ground roll ".
sentences.cn: 在俗语中,可以统称之为 “ 地滚 ” 波.

sentences.en: It is important not to be overawed by the mathematical jargon.
sentences.cn: 要紧的是不要被数学的术语所吓倒.

sentences.en: Keep it simple and avoid the use of jargon.
Sam Hawthorne , in the jargon of the times, was a Renaissance man.
sentences.cn: 萨姆·霍桑这个人,用当时的一句时髦话说, 是个有着文艺复兴时期风格的人.

sentences.en: She skipped the jargon when she read the popular science magazine.
sentences.cn: 她读那本通俗科学杂志时把其中的术语跳过未读.

sentences.en: The jargon in his talk was opaque to me.
sentences.cn: 他谈话中使用的行话对我是一团迷雾。

sentences.en: The manual is full of the jargon and slang of self-improvement courses.
sentences.cn: 手册里满是有关自修课程的行话术语。

sentences.en: The only magazine in the waiting room was a scientific journal full of technical jargon above my head.
sentences.cn: 候诊室里唯一的杂志是一份全是术语的科学期刊,我看不懂.

sentences.en: Their jargon is impenetrable to an outsider.
sentences.cn: 他们的行话外人听不懂。

sentences.en: They will not hear critics with their horrible jargon.
sentences.cn: 他们不愿意听到评论家们那些可怕的行话.

trans.tran_en: words and expressions used in a particular profession or by a particular group of people, which are difficult for other people to understand – often used to show disapproval
